positions.description:
I assisted administrative judges with legal research and writing, analyzing complex legal issues, reviewing prior court decisions, and developing the case record.  Once the record was complete, I was responsible for assisting with hearing arrangements, reviewing documentation and testimony, and conducting legal research necessary to write the initial decision.  

I conducted outreach to other agencies regarding the Merit Systems Principals and the benefits of utilizing the e-filing system.

I utilized my multitasking abilities to manage a large caseload, and make sure that the customers were assisted in a timely manner. I also made sure that I had the latest information regarding IT issues, and tried to resolve issues first hand before passing customers along.

positions.description:
Responsible for recalculating federal inmate sentence computations and verifying their release dates and for the coordination of all aspects of the legal commitment and incarceration of the federal offenders.Position also involves research and comparison of documents submitted against those actually filed by the federal courts as well as for the correction of any erroneous documents. This job requires strong detail oriented abilities, and frequent contact with the courts and other state agencies throughout both the United States and other countries.
Experience includes reviewing, interpreting, classifying and applying various laws, court orders and administrative decisions related to the inmate incarceration as well as reviewing and analyzing legal documents daily for their legitimacy. Responsible for investigating inmateâs prior criminal history, and applying the federal sentencing laws and guidelines that are the most current and up to date. Other tasks include handling general public complaints and inquiries for information, and disseminating de-classified, approved communication to those individuals.

positions.description:
Supervision Officer (Adult Probation Officer)
I supervised a case load of 144 felony, maximum classified offenders, which required home visits, office visits and documentation of all events. As a probation officer I had regular contact with the courts and court officers and maintained the highest level of ethics and standards with regard to my duties. I was moved to Quality Development (QD) and assisted in auditing all field offices in accordance to policy due to my outstanding record. Basic Office skills, faxing, copying, etc were used daily.
